buildup.text: E. Paul Torrance asked children to draw unusual pictures and imagine creative uses for everyday objects.

discovery.text: The tests score fluency (how many ideas), originality (how unique), and elaboration (how detailed).

twist.text: Torrance scores predict creative achievement better than IQ does â€” a 50-year longitudinal study confirmed this.

climax.text: The tests revealed something alarming: American children's creativity scores have declined since 1990.

punchline.text: We measure intelligence obsessively. We barely measure creativity.
